headline: Johnson & Johnson's Posdinemab and Tau Active Immunotherapy Receive U.S. FDA Fast Track Designations for the Treatment of Alzheimer's Disease
summary: Johnson & Johnson (NYSE: JNJ) announced today that the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has granted Fast Track designation to posdinemab, a phosphorylated tau-directed monoclonal antibody (mAb) being investigated to treat patients with early Alzheimer's disease (AD) in the Phase 2b "AuTonomy" study. The internally discovered mAb has shown the potential in targeting disease-associated phosphorylated tau in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) from treated AD patients, and in blocking the development
